laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At various ages, the calcium levels decreased during treatment with cinacalcet but returned to high pretreatment levels after discontinuation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: PTH levels were in the normal range but were inappropriately high for hypercalcemia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: PTH levels decreased slightly during treatment with cinacalcet.
Vitamin D supplementation was started based on low levels, but this had no effect on serum calcium.

laboratory_examinations.findings: P-Ca 2.99 mmol/L, P-Ca ion 1.39 mmol/L, P-Pi 0.72 mmol/L, P-PTH 386 ng/L, P-ALP 446 U/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Biochemical parameters varied with age but showed high calcium and PTH before the initiation of cinacalcet treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Calcium levels typically decreased with cinacalcet: e.g., at 10 y, 3 mo, P-Ca 2.66 mmol/L, P-PTH 43 ng/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's symptoms improved with normalized plasma calcium levels during treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Returned to levels seen before cinacalcet treatment, e.g., P-Ca 2.87 mmol/L.
